title: What is HTML
description: HTML (Hypertext Markup Language) structures web content using tags and elements. It defines headings, paragraphs, links, and more for web page display. Often combined with CSS and JavaScript, it's fundamental in web development. Mastery of HTML is essential for web designers and developers.
longDescription:
(Hypertext Markup Language) is the fundamental building block of the World Wide Web. It's a markup language used to structure content on web pages, defining how elements and components should be displayed in a web browser. HTML allows web developers to create structured, semantically meaningful documents that can be rendered and interpreted by web browsers, making it a crucial language for web development. What is HTML? HTML is a markup language that consists of a series of elements, each enclosed in angle brackets, like . These elements provide structure to web documents, including headings, paragraphs, lists, links, images, forms, and more. Basic Structure A minimal HTML document starts with an declaration to specify the HTML version, followed by an element enclosing two main sections: for metadata and for content. Head Section The section contains metadata such as the page title, character encoding, and links to external resources like stylesheets and scripts. Body Section The section contains the visible content of the web page, structured using various HTML elements. Text and Headings Use

to

for headings and

for paragraphs. You can also format text with (italic), (bold), and . Lists Create ordered lists with

    and unordered lists with
      . List items are marked with
    • . Links Hyperlinks are created using the element, with the href attribute specifying the URL. E.g., Visit Example. Images Embed images with the element using the src attribute, e.g., . Forms Build interactive forms with elements like
      , ,
